Dear Ms. Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the Program Manager Claudia Triestram 616-552-3662.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section Rule 126.The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff
on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/16/23, Youth was able to gain access to a male pod through
an unsecure closet. Youth was then able to get into another male
peer's room. The male youth ran into the room and closed the
door. Both male/female youths were in the closed room for about
20 seconds.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
04/25/2023.
I contacted the complainant on 04/25/2023, no additional
information was provided.
I interviewed Director at the facility on 04/26/2023. Director
confirmed there was an incident on 04/16/2023 involving Youth A
placed on Pod B, gaining access to the male Pod A. She said an
internal investigation was completed and found that Staff 1 failed
to properly secure the door to the male pod, went into the closet
that is in between the two pods to grab something for Youth A, lost
line of sight of Youth A, and that’s when Youth A entered the male
pod. Staff on the male pod immediately called security and Youth
A was escorted back to her Pod. Staff 1 was terminated. Youth
had broken the cameras on Pod B so there was no video from that
pod, but there was video footage on Pod A. Youth A was moved
to Pod C that does not have connecting doors to the male pod.
Youth A is very manipulative and admitted that she manipulated
the staff to gain access to the male pod.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 04/26/2023. Youth A is 14
years old and has been at the facility for 6 months. Youth A
admitted she manipulated the staff, to get on the boy’s pod. She
initially didn’t want to answer any questions related to the incident
and said she should be the one in trouble not the staff. She said
Staff 2 was supervising her on Pod B, she told Staff 2 to call Staff
1 who was on Pod A, Staff 2 went to the control room, Staff 1
2

opened her pod door, she told Staff 1 to get her a sweater from
the closet, then ran past him and opened the door to the male
pod. Youth A said she will continue to try to manipulate the staff,
because she does not like being locked up.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 04/26/2023. Youth B is 16
years old and has been at the facility for 8 months. Youth B is
placed on Pod A. Youth B recalled the incident involving Youth A.
He said Youth A entered the boys’ pod after Staff 1 opened the
pod door. He said Youth A ran to his room and closed the door.
He ran after her and staff immediately came and escorted her out
of his room. Youth B said there is always a staff member
supervising the residents on his pod. He did not express any
concerns regarding the staff.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 04/26/2023. Supervisor 1 said he
responded to the incident involving Youth A gaining access to the
male pod. He said Youth A was on Pod B and she was able to
gain access to Pod A (male pod) through a secured door that
connects to a short hallway with a closet between the two pods.
Staff 3 immediately called for assistance and Supervisor 1
responded with security to Pod A. He said Youth A was escorted
back to Pod B. Supervisor 1 said he has worked at the facility 6
years and this has never happened. He said Staff 1 made a
horrible mistake by not ensuring the door to Pod A was locked
before opening the door to Pod B.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/17/2023. Staff 1 is a
Youth Worker and has been working at the facility for 5 months.
He recalled the incident involving Youth A. Staff 2 was supervising
Youth A on Pod B. He said Youth A asked him to call Staff 1. Staff
2 went to the control room and that’s when he heard the call for
security about Youth A going onto the boys Pod. He said Youth A
was agitated, refused to go to her room, so he could not recall
why or who opened the door leading to the closet hallway.
Video Reviewed:
Video of Pod A, from 04/16/2023 at 8:00 pm was reviwed. Staff 1
opens the door leading to the hallway with the closet and Pod B. A
few seconds later Youth A enters Pod A and goes to one of the
bedrooms and closes the door. Staff 3 calls for assistance. Youth
A is escorted out of the bedroom and back to Pod B.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 04/16/2023.Youth A was able to gain
access to Pod A through the door leading to the hallway
3

that leads into Pod B. Youth A enters Pod A and goes to
one of the bedroom’s and closes the door. Staff 3 entered
the control room and calls for assistance. Staff 1 comes
back on Pod A and opens the bedroom door. Security
escorts Youth A out of the bedroom and back to Pod B.
• Internal Investigation report dated 04/21/2023, completed
by Director. Findings: Staff 1 failing to secure the closet
corridor violated the employee ethics, Prohibited Conduct,
and Youth Supervision Policies. Staff 1 was terminated.
• Staff 1 written statement dated 04/21/2023. On 04/16/2023
Staff 1 was on Pod A, he went into the closet to get a
resident clothes, a female resident ran onto Pod A.
• Facility’s Supervision Policy: Staff shall maintain within
continuous line of sight supervision when youths are
outside of their bedrooms. Line of sight supervision is
defined as “coordinating all activities of the residents under
your supervision so that visible contact is maintained, and
the actions of resident are under observation at all times.”
Analysis The facility is in violation based on video footage and staff and
youth interviews confirming Youth A was able to gain access to
the male pod. Staff 1 did not properly secure the door to Pod B,
when going to the closet corridor, and failed to maintain Youth A in
line of sight, which resulted in Youth A going onto the male pod.
The facility had completed an internal investigation prior to this
investigation and the staff member involved was terminated.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
